DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Highest Level Prostate-Specific Antigen Result PSA Lab Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood or tissue for the highest level of kallikrein-related sequence enzyme used as a biomarker for prostate cancer.:a PSA (prostate specific antigen) laboratory value.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Highest Level Prostate-Specific Antigen Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood or tissue for the highest level of kallikrein-related sequence enzyme used as a biomarker for prostate cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Approaching or constituting a maximum; the highest point (of something).:A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.  (NCI):Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Approaching or constituting a maximum; the highest point (of something).
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.
Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: revised relationship to EVS terminology.  **Laboratory Clean-Up**

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a PSA (prostate specific antigen) laboratory value.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
